SEARCH
Module org.jandle
Package org.jandle.api.cookies

Class ResponseCookie

java.lang.Object
org.jandle.api.cookies.ResponseCookie
public class ResponseCookie extends Object
Represents an HTTP response cookie and provides a fluent-style API for configuring Set-Cookie attributes.

This class is responsible only for cookie definition and serialization. When converted to a string, it produces a valid Set-Cookie header value that can be attached to a HttpResponse.

Supported cookie attributes include:

  • Name
  • Value
  • Domain
  • Path
  • Max-Age
  • Expires
  • Secure flag
  • HttpOnly flag
  • SameSite policy
  • Partitioned cookies (CHIPS)

Validation rules are enforced according to modern browser requirements:

  • SameSite=None requires Secure=true
  • Partitioned requires Secure=true

Example usage: 


 ResponseCookie cookie = new ResponseCookie("session", "abc123");
 cookie.setHttpOnly(true);
 cookie.setSecure(true);
 cookie.setSameSite(SameSite.NONE);
 cookie.setMaxAgeSeconds(3600);

 response.cookie(cookie);

      SameSite=None requires Secure=true.

      this ResponseCookie for chaining.
      Throws:
